body:
Can you link to your cfg and weights file?

Clearly I canâ€™t reproduce your error from a screenshot buddy.

Thanks, for answer.
Weight file https://drive.google.com/open?id=1nUYcsmC1T8njg7XgyfUACGnqSLZaOIKG
cfg file https://github.com/Lepiloff/pyolo/blob/master/cfg/yolov3_ls.cfg

It looks like your cfg is creating a non-standard architecture. It's not YOLOv3 anymore.

So models.py isn't designed to import arbitrary architectures, only yolov3, yolov3-tiny, and yolov3-spp. You could modify it accordingly to add this functionality yourself, in which case PRs are welcome!
Yes, this is a modified file. Ok, is it possible to train new model with yolov3-openimages.weights from official darknet repository with own image dataset?

It looks like the repo loads your weights correctly, and you can create a corresponding yolov3_ls_2000.pt pytorch weights file. The problem is the current implementation is calculating stride based on the assumption of 3 yolo layers. It should be possible to modify the implementation to determine stride directly from `img_size/nG`, to make it more robust to arbitrary implementations. This would obviously make the repo more valuable from a research perspective.

I have not tried yolov3-openimages.weights, but I just tried it now, and it works fine, though seemingly a bit worse than regular yolov3.weights. Remember to set the classes correctly on detect.py line 51 before you run:
`classes = load_classes(parse_data_cfg('cfg/openimages.data')['names'])`

```
Then you should see:
Namespace(cfg='cfg/yolov3-openimages.cfg', conf_thres=0.5, images='data/samples', img_size=416, nms_thres=0.45, weights='weights/yolov3-openimages.weights')
Using cpu

image 1/1 data/samples/zidane.jpg: 2 Persons, 1 Clothings, Done. (1.132s)
```
![zidane](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26833433/53029081-75da6180-3468-11e9-968e-9ff61d6281d5.jpg)

@Lepiloff I updated models.py to accept arbitrarily shaped networks from any darknet cfg file: 9c96e7b6cd9cd1e41b74662158fd6e608705d2d6. Your custom `yolov3_ls_2000.weights` network now runs with detect.py without error. Beware it doesn't detect anything in the sample image however.

```
/Users/glennjocher/.conda/envs/yolov3/bin/python /Users/glennjocher/PycharmProjects/yolov3/detect.py
Namespace(cfg='cfg/yolov3_ls.cfg', conf_thres=0.5, images='data/samples', img_size=416, nms_thres=0.45, weights='weights/yolov3_ls_2000.weights')
Using cpu

image 1/1 data/samples/zidane.jpg: Done. (1.423s)
```
Wow! I will definitely try tomorrow. It doesn't detect anything because trained only for one class )

I updated your latest commit and find the following issues:
```
   Epoch       Batch        xy        wh      conf       cls     total  nTargets      time
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 207, in <module>
    var=opt.var,
  File "train.py", line 129, in train
    loss = model(imgs.to(device), targets, var=var)
  File "/home/dongpeijie/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 489, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/media/cieserver/209b4bc6-b4ad-4a37-b5ee-cde3c165103e/dpj/yolov3-master/models.py", line 253, in forward
    x, *losses = module[0](x, img_size, targets, var)
  File "/home/dongpeijie/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 489, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/media/cieserver/209b4bc6-b4ad-4a37-b5ee-cde3c165103e/dpj/yolov3-master/models.py", line 157, in forward
    txy, twh, mask, tcls = build_targets(targets, self.anchor_vec, self.nA, self.nC, nG)
  File "/media/cieserver/209b4bc6-b4ad-4a37-b5ee-cde3c165103e/dpj/yolov3-master/utils/utils.py", line 242, in build_targets
    inter_area = torch.min(box1, box2).prod(2)
RuntimeError: Expected object of backend CPU but got backend CUDA for argument #2 'other'
```
Moreover, The yolov3-tiny is still processed in the model.py file.

I tried to run with new models.py and modified detect.py line 51 and got an error 
  ```
File "/home/y700/projects/ultralytics/models.py", line 209, in forward
    p[..., 2:4] = torch.exp(p[..., 2:4]) * self.anchor_wh  # wh
RuntimeError: expected type torch.cuda.FloatTensor but got torch.FloatTensor

```
Apparently now there is a problem with using a GPU. And I didn't understand  how to turn off the GPU for testing and use CPU?

You are right, thank you for the notice. This error is fixed now. To disable GPU for the entire repo you can set `force_cpu=True` here:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/a65a383d3a81dd56a31271936cc8045dfbb4d645/utils/torch_utils.py#L11
@pprp thanks for the notice, others have said the same thing. This error is fixed now. I don't understand your comment about yolov3-tiny however. Can you elaborate?
@Lepiloff This repo has **identical inference results** to darknet when using the same weights.

@glenn-jocher , Now I'm a little at a loss. I checked on a model trained on a standard yolo3.cfg file with 3 [yolo] layers. Using the same files I got different final results. 
cfg file - https://github.com/Lepiloff/pyolo/blob/master/cfg/yolo-obj.cfg
weight file - https://drive.google.com/file/d/1g_8JL1J9cNp3uE5GCPc5aucQ-qu7iPRd/view?usp=sharing
test img - https://github.com/Lepiloff/pyolo/blob/master/imgs/swarm-of-bees.jpg

Some images:
DARKNET.
![6000_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28572064/53156516-a3dab580-35d0-11e9-9681-ab8da91169ef.png)
![600-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28572064/53156540-afc67780-35d0-11e9-9b25-6ad84e6a6106.png)

ULTRALYTICS
![2019-02-21 11-48-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28572064/53156579-c076ed80-35d0-11e9-85e3-4981567b47b7.png)
@Lepiloff did you match hyperparameters? `conf_thresh`, `nms_thresh`, etc? You realize you can alter these yourself right?

Sorry to bother you again.
The following is my cfg file:
[https://github.com/pprp/yolov3/blob/master/cfg/v3tiny_spp.cfg](https://github.com/pprp/yolov3/blob/master/cfg/v3tiny_spp.cfg)
I got error:
```
   Epoch       Batch        xy        wh      conf       cls     total  nTargets      time
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 205, in <module>
    var=opt.var,
  File "train.py", line 130, in train
    loss.backward()
  File "/home/learner/miniconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 106, in backward
    torch.autograd.backward(self, gradient, retain_graph, create_graph)
  File "/home/learner/miniconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/autograd/__init__.py", line 93, in backward
    allow_unreachable=True)  # allow_unreachable flag
RuntimeError: element 0 of tensors does not require grad and does not have a grad_fn
```
I also tried the cfg file:
[https://github.com/Lepiloff/pyolo/blob/master/cfg/yolov3_ls.cfg](https://github.com/Lepiloff/pyolo/blob/master/cfg/yolov3_ls.cfg)

But I got the error below:
```
   Epoch       Batch        xy        wh      conf       cls     total  nTargets      time
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 205, in <module>
    var=opt.var,
  File "train.py", line 129, in train
    loss = model(imgs.to(device), targets, var=var)
  File "/home/learner/miniconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 491, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/media/cieserver/209b4bc6-b4ad-4a37-b5ee-cde3c165103e/dpj/yolov3-master/models.py", line 251, in forward
    x, *losses = module[0](x, img_size, targets, var)
  File "/home/learner/miniconda3/envs/yolov3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 491, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/media/cieserver/209b4bc6-b4ad-4a37-b5ee-cde3c165103e/dpj/yolov3-master/models.py", line 153, in forward
    txy, twh, mask, tcls = build_targets(targets, self.anchor_vec, self.nA, self.nC, nG)
  File "/media/cieserver/209b4bc6-b4ad-4a37-b5ee-cde3c165103e/dpj/yolov3-master/utils/utils.py", line 280, in build_targets
    tcls[b, a, gj, gi, tc] = 1
RuntimeError: index 2 is out of bounds for dim with size 1
```

@glenn-jocher At darknet I changed only  -thresh 0.45, all other parameters are default. At your repo,  I left everything unchanged 
```
--conf-thres default=0.5
--nms-thres' default=0.45
```
--img-size  are the same 1024
